newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Nikkei futures tumble at close, outlook bleak.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Nikkei futures tumble at close, outlook bleak.

text.p: SIMEX Nikkei futures shed a large part of their recent gains, ending sharply lower on Monday as players took profit after the Japanese general election.
Some dealers said the Liberal Democratic Party's (LDP) failure to emerge with a majority caused players to cash in positions built up in anticipation of such a result.

"There's been some position adjustment because the LDP didn't get a clear win," said a trader with a local institution. "They will need to form some alliances to get the government going and we don't know what's going to happen."
The benchmark Nikkei 225 December contract tumbled from 21,705 at the open to close at 21,245. Its previous settlement was at 21,715.
"It broke through intermediate support at 21,460 today and that's bad," said the trader, adding that the market's close below the 21,275 level also sent a bearish signal.
He said the December Nikkei would be supported at 21,155 and a close above 21,275 would allow it to consolidate before heading higher.
A Japanese bank dealer said the Dow's move could have some influence on the Nikkei's direction on Tuesday.
"This was purely profit-taking," he said, adding that the December Nikkei could head down to 20,800 if it failed to hold above 21,000.
